title: Favorite off-meta junglers
body:
With all of the talk about there being no jungle diversity, who are your favorite oddball jungle picks and why?

My far right now are fizz and yasuo. Fizz because his ganks and tower picks are top notch, and yasuo because nothing is more fun than blinking into lane out f nowhere with your ult.

replies.body: Nautilus. Because tanks are so off meta its silly, followed by skarner and warwick, both esentially having poor presence after a single skill. though skarner makes up for this by being silly powerful as a tank
I actually really like the flavor of skarner scuttling out of  the brush to ult someone and drag them back to his nest haha

Have to second Nautilus as a favourite.  I have had so many teams where everyone else picks a damage oriented champion and our team really need the durability, initiation and CC that Nautilus provides.
so far ive had slight luck with a couple of jungle lucian games, the drive-by ganks

Twitch. 

Amazing ganks, amazing damage with just Warrior and BoRK (I don't go Devourer because with Devourer you take huge damage in the jungle and get a lower power spike for mid game), late game monster, less pressure since you are 2nd ADC so you get to build more utility, true damage to squishies with the arpen build.

{{champion:68}} And yes, I do use Rumble In the Jungle when I use him in the jungle. I start Flamespitter and spam it to over 50% heat until buff spawns (Doesn't matter whether it's Krugs or Gromp, I start the side I can get a leash from bot with), then I put a point into W to help mitigate the damage I take from the other camps and then E. 

The key is to get Chilling Smite and then focus on ganking, only farming your jungle when there's no opportunities for ganks. Don't finish your jungle item until you've finished some other AP item (I tend to prefer getting Rylais first for more CC), while it has good stats, the CDR isn't that important for you due to your passive and I think it's better to get items that can help with your ganks or getting through the jungle better.

I also tend to get mobi's early and switch them out for Sorc Shoes once lanning phase ends.

:O Yasuo jungle works!?

When is he on rotation next!?! I want this now!

my favourite is gonna have to be Akali, whom I love in the jungle because dipping in with Trailblazer and smite is basically all you need for sustain, as well as the nifty ganks post-6, and just the feel of sneaking into a lane with my shroud. 

I can't quite figure out a good first clear though. I'm running 14/2/14 masteries, with spellvamp quintessences (so I get to start with a bit more than 15% spellvamp and three buiscuits) but while I love the utility mastery setup, I'm not convinced I've found a truly good route yet.

Is starting gromp safe enough as Akali? I usually start krugs, but I wanna try gromp->Wolves->Red to see if that gives me better sucess.

Yasuo jungle does work, but you need to get trailblazer ASAP. I've fiddled with devourer but I think it's best to just go straight for static shiv after your smite upgrade.  His ganks aren't the best but he is a late game monster and a good duelist.

I also use lifesteal runes but I'm not sure if they are needed.
How do you handle the first clear? Feel like it would be pretty brutal. What's your setup?

I usually start Krugs but sometimes I just start where I can get a better leash.   

My normal route is starting Krugs, then red, then depending on my health either raptors then back or if I have a decent amount of health I go to gromp and jungle until my health is low. 

Once you get trailblazer it's easy. 

Some tips for keeping your health up are killing the small raptors first at their camp and using your shield by dashing and moving between your autos to charge your flow.  You can also windwall some damage, mainly gromp, dragon, and baron.

For runes I run armor, crit chance and life steal, masteries are 21/9/0
{{champion:114}} awesome damage in ganks and she can duel just about anyone in the jungle at any point. meaning yes I am likely to counter jungle you :P

I loved TF So much, too bad he's never going to get any compensation for the Soft reset nerfs :/
That diversity.
Rammus. He's slow in the beginning, but his ganks are good and his damage surprises. He becomes nearly unkillable late game. He's like the Tristana of tanks.
Leona jungle. Might have terrible clear speed and an early vulnerability to invades, but it has some scary gank power and does well as a counter-ganker too.
